birth_place.zh-cn: 四川省广安州望溪乡姚坪里

death_place.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军总医院

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的第二代最高领导人，中国共产党第二代中央领导集体的核心，被官方誉为“改革开放的总设计师”。其政治生涯经历了“三落三起”。
description.en: The second-generation paramount leader of the People's Republic of China and the core of the second-generation central leadership collective of the Chinese Communist Party, officially hailed as the "Chief Architect of Reform and Opening-up." His political career was marked by "three downfalls and three comebacks."

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党、中国人民解放军和中华人民共和国的主要缔造者和领导人，中华人民共和国第一代最高领导人。
description.en: A key founder and leader of the Chinese Communist Party, the People's Liberation Army, and the People's Republic of China, and the first-generation paramount leader of the PRC.

description.zh-cn: 由毛泽东发动和领导的政治运动，对中国社会造成了深远而复杂的冲击。
description.en: A political movement initiated and led by Mao Zedong, which had a profound and complex impact on Chinese society.

description.zh-cn: 指中国文化大革命期间王洪文、张春桥、江青、姚文元四人结成的政治集团。
description.en: A political faction composed of four Chinese Communist Party officials: Wang Hongwen, Zhang Chunqiao, Jiang Qing, and Yao Wenyuan, who were prominent during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的主要领导人之一，曾任中华人民共和国国务院总理。
description.en: One of the main leaders of the Chinese Communist Party and the People's Republic of China, who served as the first Premier of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 1976年4月5日在北京天安门广场发生的，以悼念周恩来、反对“四人帮”、拥护邓小平为主题的群众运动。
description.en: A mass movement that took place on April 5, 1976, in Tiananmen Square, Beijing, centered on mourning Zhou Enlai, opposing the Gang of Four, and supporting Deng Xiaoping.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东逝世后的中国最高领导人，曾任中共中央主席、国务院总理、中央军委主席。
description.en: The paramount leader of China after Mao Zedong's death, who served as Chairman of the CCP Central Committee, Premier of the State Council, and Chairman of the Central Military Commission.

description.zh-cn: 1978年中共十一届三中全会后，中国开始实行的以经济改革和对外开放为中心的国策。
description.en: A national policy centered on economic reform and opening up to the outside world, initiated in China after the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee of the CCP in 1978.

nodes.id: 中国共产党第十一届中央委员会第三次全体会议

zh-cn: 中国共产党第十一届中央委员会第三次全体会议

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党历史上具有深远意义的转折点，会议确立了邓小平的领导核心地位，并将党和国家的工作重心转移到经济建设上来，开启了改革开放。
description.en: A pivotal turning point in the history of the Chinese Communist Party, which established Deng Xiaoping's core leadership position, shifted the focus of the party and state to economic construction, and initiated the era of Reform and Opening-up.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的主要领导人之一，曾任中华人民共和国主席，在文化大革命中被迫害致死。
description.en: One of the main leaders of the Chinese Communist Party and the People's Republic of China, who served as Chairman of the PRC and was persecuted to death during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国元帅，文化大革命时期的中共第二号人物，后因九一三事件在蒙古温都尔汗坠机身亡。
description.en: A Marshal of the People's Republic of China and the second-in-command during the Cultural Revolution. He died in a plane crash in Öndörkhaan, Mongolia, following the Lin Biao incident.

description.zh-cn: 指中共中央副主席林彪及其家人在试图乘机叛逃苏联途中，于蒙古温都尔汗坠机身亡的事件。
description.en: Refers to the incident where CCP Vice Chairman Lin Biao and his family died in a plane crash in Öndörkhaan, Mongolia, while attempting to defect to the Soviet Union.

description.zh-cn: 1957年至1958年间中国共产党发动的一场政治运动，旨在打击被认为是“右派”的知识分子和异议人士。
description.en: A political campaign launched by the Chinese Communist Party from 1957 to 1958, aimed at cracking down on intellectuals and dissidents deemed "rightists."

description.zh-cn: 曾任中共中央主席和中共中央总书记，是改革开放早期的主要领导人之一。
description.en: Served as Chairman and General Secretary of the CCP Central Committee, and was one of the key leaders during the early period of Reform and Opening-up.

description.zh-cn: 曾任中华人民共和国国务院总理和中共中央总书记，因在六四事件中对学生表示同情而被撤职。
description.en: Served as Premier of the State Council and General Secretary of the CCP Central Committee. He was dismissed from his posts for showing sympathy towards students during the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests.

description.zh-cn: 1989年春夏之交在北京天安门广场发生的一场以学生为主导的民主运动，最终以武力清场告终。
description.en: A student-led democracy movement that took place in Tiananmen Square, Beijing, in the spring and summer of 1989, which ended with a military crackdown.

description.zh-cn: 1992年初，已退休的邓小平视察中国南方并发表一系列讲话，强调坚持改革开放，对中国90年代的经济改革与社会进步起到了关键的推动作用。
description.en: In early 1992, the retired Deng Xiaoping inspected southern China and delivered a series of speeches emphasizing adherence to reform and opening-up, which played a crucial role in promoting China's economic reform and social progress in the 1990s.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党第三代中央领导集体的核心，曾任中共中央总书记、国家主席、中央军委主席。
description.en: The core of the third generation of the CCP's central leadership, who served as General Secretary of the CCP Central Committee, President of the PRC, and Chairman of the Central Military Commission.

description.zh-cn: 指文化大革命结束后，中国纠正文革期间及以前“左”倾错误的思想、政治、组织、经济等一系列工作的总称。
description.en: Refers to the overall process of correcting the "leftist" errors in ideology, politics, organization, and economy from the Cultural Revolution and earlier periods, which took place after the end of the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 邓小平为解决香港、澳门及台湾问题而提出的构想，即在同一个中国的前提下，国家主体实行社会主义，香港、澳门、台湾保持原有的资本主义制度和生活方式。
description.en: A concept proposed by Deng Xiaoping to resolve the issues of Hong Kong, Macau, and Taiwan, which suggests that under the premise of one China, the mainland practices socialism while Hong Kong, Macau, and Taiwan maintain their existing capitalist systems and lifestyles.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国元帅，中国人民解放军的缔造者之一。在抗日战争和国共内战期间，与邓小平长期搭档，其部队被称为“刘邓大军”。
description.en: A Marshal of the People's Republic of China and one of the founders of the People's Liberation Army. He partnered with Deng Xiaoping for many years during the Second Sino-Japanese War and the Chinese Civil War, with their forces known as the "Liu-Deng Army."

description.zh-cn: 邓小平的第三任妻子。
description.en: The third wife of Deng Xiaoping.

description.zh-cn: 邓小平的父亲。
description.en: Father of Deng Xiaoping.

description.zh-cn: 邓小平的母亲。
description.en: Mother of Deng Xiaoping.

description.zh-cn: 邓小平的第一任妻子。
description.en: The first wife of Deng Xiaoping.

description.zh-cn: 邓小平的第二任妻子。
description.en: The second wife of Deng Xiaoping.

description.zh-cn: 邓小平的长子，在文革中被迫害致残。
description.en: Eldest son of Deng Xiaoping, who was persecuted and became disabled during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 中共中央在长征途中召开的一次政治局扩大会议，确立了毛泽东在党和红军中的领导地位。
description.en: An enlarged meeting of the Politburo of the CCP Central Committee held during the Long March, which established Mao Zedong's leadership position in the party and the Red Army.

description.zh-cn: 前中共中央总书记胡耀邦的逝世，成为1989年天安门事件的导火索。
description.en: The death of former CCP General Secretary Hu Yaobang, which became a trigger for the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的主要领导人之一，被视为党内保守派的代表人物。
description.en: One of the main leaders of the Chinese Communist Party and the People's Republic of China, often regarded as a leading figure of the conservative faction within the party.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国元帅，在粉碎“四人帮”的怀仁堂事变中起了决定性作用。
description.en: A Marshal of the People's Republic of China who played a decisive role in the Huairentang Incident that led to the downfall of the Gang of Four.

description.zh-cn: 由华国锋、叶剑英、汪东兴等人策划，在中南海怀仁堂逮捕“四人帮”成员的事件，标志着文化大革命的结束。
description.en: An event planned by Hua Guofeng, Ye Jianying, Wang Dongxing and others, leading to the arrest of the members of the Gang of Four at Huairentang in Zhongnanhai, which marked the end of the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 指“凡是毛主席作出的决策，我们都坚决维护；凡是毛主席的指示，我们都始终不渝地遵循”的政治口号，是华国锋时期的指导思想，后受到邓小平等人的批判。
description.en: Refers to the political slogan "We will resolutely uphold whatever policy decisions Chairman Mao made, and unswervingly follow whatever instructions Chairman Mao gave." It was the guiding ideology during the Hua Guofeng era and was later criticized by Deng Xiaoping and others.

description.zh-cn: 英国政治家，曾任英国首相。1980年代就香港前途问题与邓小平进行谈判。
description.en: A British stateswoman who served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom. She negotiated with Deng Xiaoping on the future of Hong Kong in the 1980s.

description.zh-cn: 美国第39任总统，在其任内中美两国正式建立外交关系。
description.en: The 39th President of the United States. During his presidency, the United States and China formally established diplomatic relations.

description.zh-cn: 1979年中国人民解放军在云南、广西边境对越南发动的军事行动。
description.en: A military operation launched by the Chinese People's Liberation Army in 1979 against Vietnam along the Sino-Vietnamese border in Yunnan and Guangxi.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国国务院

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国国务院
en: State Council of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国中央人民政府。
description.en: The Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 在文化大革命期间，邓小平被作为“党内第二号走资本主义道路的当权派”打倒，被撤销一切职务并下放江西劳动。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Deng Xiaoping was purged as the "No. 2 capitalist-roader in the Party," stripped of all his posts, and sent to work in Jiangxi.

description.zh-cn: 邓小平1975年主持的全面整顿与“四人帮”发生激烈冲突，“四人帮”将其诬蔑为“右倾翻案风”并加以批判。
description.en: The comprehensive rectification led by Deng Xiaoping in 1975 led to intense conflicts with the Gang of Four, who vilified it as a "right-deviationist wind to reverse correct verdicts" and subjected him to criticism.

description.zh-cn: 四五运动后，邓小平被指为事件的“总后台”，再次被撤销党内外一切职务。
description.en: After the 1976 Tiananmen Incident, Deng Xiaoping was accused of being the "black hand" behind the event and was once again stripped of all his positions inside and outside the Party.

description.zh-cn: 林彪集团的覆灭为邓小平的第三次复出创造了政治契机。
description.en: The downfall of the Lin Biao clique created a political opportunity for Deng Xiaoping's third political comeback.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东对邓小平的来信作出批示，肯定其历史功绩，并将其与刘少奇区别开来，为其在1973年的复出铺平了道路。
description.en: Mao Zedong commented on Deng Xiaoping's letter, affirming his historical achievements and distinguishing him from Liu Shaoqi, paving the way for his return to politics in 1973.

description.zh-cn: 邓小平是中国改革开放的总设计师，在中共十一届三中全会上确立了其领导核心地位，主导了将党和国家工作重心转移到经济建设上来的历史性决策。
description.en: Deng Xiaoping was the chief architect of China's reform and opening-up. At the Third Plenary Session of the 11th CCP Central Committee, he established his core leadership position and led the historic decision to shift the focus of the party and state to economic construction.

relationships.source: 中国共产党第十一届中央委员会第三次全体会议

description.zh-cn: 在中共十一届三中全会上，邓小平确立了其在党内的领导核心地位，取代华国锋成为中国的实际最高领导人。
description.en: At the Third Plenary Session of the 11th CCP Central Committee, Deng Xiaoping established his core leadership position within the party, replacing Hua Guofeng as the de facto paramount leader of China.

description.zh-cn: 邓小平复出后，与坚持“两个凡是”的华国锋在思想路线和政治路线上发生分歧，最终在中共十一届三中全会上取代了华国锋的最高领导地位。
description.en: After his political comeback, Deng Xiaoping had ideological and political disagreements with Hua Guofeng, who adhered to the "Two Whatevers." Deng eventually replaced Hua as the paramount leader at the Third Plenary Session of the 11th CCP Central Committee.

description.zh-cn: 在1986年的学潮后，邓小平批评胡耀邦反对资产阶级自由化不力，导致胡耀邦被迫辞去中共中央总书记职务。
description.en: After the student protests of 1986, Deng Xiaoping criticized Hu Yaobang for his ineffective opposition to bourgeois liberalization, which led to Hu's forced resignation as General Secretary of the CCP Central Committee.

description.zh-cn: 因赵紫阳在六四事件中对学生表现出同情，邓小平决定撤销其所有职务。
description.en: Deng Xiaoping decided to remove Zhao Ziyang from all his posts due to Zhao's sympathy for the students during the 1989 Tiananmen Square incident.

description.zh-cn: 胡耀邦的逝世引发了大规模的民众悼念活动，并迅速演变为全国性的学生民主运动，成为六四事件的导火索。
description.en: The death of Hu Yaobang triggered large-scale public mourning activities, which quickly evolved into a nationwide student democracy movement, becoming the catalyst for the 1989 Tiananmen Square incident.

description.zh-cn: 作为中央军委主席，邓小平批准了对天安门广场的清场行动，以武力结束了学生运动。
description.en: As Chairman of the Central Military Commission, Deng Xiaoping approved the military action to clear Tiananmen Square, ending the student movement by force.

description.zh-cn: 在六四事件后，邓小平决定从上海调来江泽民，任命其为新一任中共中央总书记，并确立其为第三代领导集体的核心。
description.en: After the 1989 Tiananmen Square incident, Deng Xiaoping decided to bring Jiang Zemin from Shanghai and appoint him as the new General Secretary of the CCP Central Committee, establishing him as the core of the third-generation leadership collective.

description.zh-cn: 邓小平的南方谈话，重新推动了在六四事件后一度停滞的改革开放进程，强调市场经济，为中国经济的再次高速发展奠定了思想基础。
description.en: Deng Xiaoping's Southern Tour talks re-energized the reform and opening-up process, which had stagnated after the 1989 Tiananmen incident. He emphasized the market economy, laying the ideological foundation for another period of rapid economic growth in China.

description.zh-cn: 邓小平提出了“一国两制”的构想，作为解决香港、澳门及台湾问题的基本方针。
description.en: Deng Xiaoping proposed the "One country, two systems" concept as the fundamental policy for resolving the issues of Hong Kong, Macau, and Taiwan.

description.zh-cn: 在长达13年的时间里，邓小平与刘伯承并肩作战，他们的部队被称为“刘邓大军”，共同开辟和领导了晋冀鲁豫根据地，并指挥了淮海战役和渡江战役等重大战役。
description.en: For 13 years, Deng Xiaoping and Liu Bocheng fought side by side, and their troops were known as the "Liu-Deng Army." They jointly established and led the Shanxi-Hebei-Shandong-Henan Base Area and commanded major campaigns such as the Huaihai Campaign and the Yangtze River Crossing Campaign.

description.zh-cn: 邓小平担任中共中央反右领导小组组长，主持并积极推进了反右运动。
description.en: Deng Xiaoping served as the head of the CCP Central Committee's Anti-Rightist Leading Group, presiding over and actively promoting the Anti-Rightist Campaign.

relationships.target: 中国共产党中央军事委员会
中华人民共和国中央军事委员会
中华人民共和国国务院

description.zh-cn: 邓小平与周恩来在法国勤工俭学时相识，此后建立了长达半个世纪的友谊与工作关系。
description.en: Deng Xiaoping and Zhou Enlai met during their work-study program in France, and thereafter established a friendship and working relationship that lasted for half a century.

description.zh-cn: 就香港前途问题展开谈判，邓小平明确表明中国在主权问题上没有妥协空间。
description.en: Negotiated on the future of Hong Kong, where Deng Xiaoping clearly stated that there was no room for compromise on the issue of sovereignty.

description.zh-cn: 作为中华人民共和国成立后首位访美的中国领导人，与美国总统卡特会谈，深入交流中美关系正常化问题。
description.en: As the first Chinese leader to visit the United States after the founding of the PRC, he held talks with President Carter to thoroughly discuss the normalization of Sino-US relations.

description.zh-cn: 作为中央军委的实际领导人，邓小平决策并领导了对越自卫反击战。
description.en: As the de facto leader of the Central Military Commission, Deng Xiaoping made the decision to launch and led the Sino-Vietnamese War.

description.zh-cn: 华国锋、叶剑英等人发动怀仁堂事变，逮捕了“四人帮”成员，结束了文化大革命。
description.en: Hua Guofeng, Ye Jianying and others launched the Huairentang Incident, arresting the members of the Gang of Four and ending the Cultural Revolution.
